{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3437691,"name":"JAMES","username":"JAAMES","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jaames/{size}/231436_2.png","created_at":"2024-10-22T15:30:10.357Z","cooked":"

Hi, my team has used the harbor freight 3/16 rivet gun for some time now (This). It started failing recently and we are looking for a new, preferably electronic one in the realm of 100 dollars. Any ideas?

(also any ideas on how to escape the roibi ecosystem)

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":33,"updated_at":"2024-10-22T15:39:05.761Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":500,"reads":598,"readers_count":597,"score":2654.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":473434,"topic_slug":"rivet-gun-and-escaping-the-roibi-ecosystem","display_username":"JAMES","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.harborfreight.com/air-tools-compressors/air-tools/air-riveters/3-16-inch-air-hydraulic-riveter-93458.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":104}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64837,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"_Jaames"},"post_url":"/t/rivet-gun-and-escaping-the-roibi-ecosystem/473434/1","custom_user_title":"_Jaames","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3437696,"name":"Travis Weir","username":"tweirtx","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tweirtx/{size}/12204_2.png","created_at":"2024-10-22T15:38:53.933Z","cooked":"

Unfortunately the only electronic ones I’m aware of are a poorly designed DeWalt one and a Milwaukee one that’s pretty good but $250. Or a couple of Makitas for a lot more than that… For that price range you’ll probably want to stick to manual or pneumatic

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":33,"updated_at":"2024-10-22T15:38:53.933Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":583,"readers_count":582,"score":201.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":473434,"topic_slug":"rivet-gun-and-escaping-the-roibi-ecosystem","display_username":"Travis Weir","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":33359,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Michigan Scorekeeper (formerly Texas)"},"post_url":"/t/rivet-gun-and-escaping-the-roibi-ecosystem/473434/2","custom_user_title":"Michigan Scorekeeper (formerly Texas)","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3437697,"name":"Tim James","username":"Tim708","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tim708/{size}/189359_2.png","created_at":"2024-10-22T15:39:03.604Z","cooked":"

It’s out of your target price range but in my opinion this is the best $250 my team has spent in a long time.

milwaukeetool.com

M12™ Rivet Tool (Tool Only)

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":33,"updated_at":"2024-10-22T15:39:03.604Z","reply_count":3,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":563,"readers_count":562,"score":602.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":473434,"topic_slug":"rivet-gun-and-escaping-the-roibi-ecosystem","display_username":"Tim James","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.milwaukeetool.com/Products/2550-20","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"M12™ Rivet Tool (Tool Only)","clicks":51}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":28}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":9303,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/rivet-gun-and-escaping-the-roibi-ecosystem/473434/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":16},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":12}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":28,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3437704,"name":"Chris Herzog","username":"zog","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/zog/{size}/266762_2.png","created_at":"2024-10-22T15:47:06.948Z","cooked":"

Second the Milwaukee M12. I’m both in the Makita 18v LXT and Milwaukee M12 systems and first went looking for a Makita - for some reason, it sells for around $1,000 (yes, you read that correctly, $1,000 as in 900 Euros or 150,000 Yen - that better be one heck of a rivet tool).

There are Makita clones on eBay for something like $60 (*yes, $60) - I bought one to mess with and I’ve done maybe 100 rivets or so with that and it hasn’t exploded yet. I opened it up and the construction seemed pretty typical; some machined, some MIM parts - about what I’d expect.

I bought the Milwaukee as well and it’s a super solid tool - really my go to now.

So $100 is not really going to get you into the game but it’s not that much more for quality.

[ FRC 2151 + 3061 | Ri3D Redux '23 | RIP 4292 & 4241 ]"},"post_url":"/t/rivet-gun-and-escaping-the-roibi-ecosystem/473434/4","custom_user_title":"Doin' robot stuff... [ FRC 2151 + 3061 | Ri3D Redux '23 | RIP 4292 & 4241 ]","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3437705,"name":"paulonis","username":"paulonis","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/5fc32e/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-10-22T15:47:11.531Z","cooked":"

Another vote for the Milwaukee M12 Rivet Tool. If you do much riveting, you just need to find something else in the budget to not buy in order to afford this. It doesn’t usually go on sale, but Black Friday is coming up.

If you aren’t willing to move on budget, you are willing to take a manual riveter to competition, but want a power tool at the shop, you could get a pneumatic rivet gun if you have a compressor at the shop. You’d have a hose dragging around the floor, but it would cost less and work well.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":33,"updated_at":"2024-10-22T15:47:11.531Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":456,"readers_count":455,"score":171.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":473434,"topic_slug":"rivet-gun-and-escaping-the-roibi-ecosystem","display_username":"paulonis","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.amazon.com/Astro-Pneumatic-Tool-PR14-Riveter/dp/B000MQ9H4W/ref=sr_1_21","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Amazon.com","clicks":7}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":22261,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/rivet-gun-and-escaping-the-roibi-ecosystem/473434/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3437707,"name":"Chris Herzog","username":"zog","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/zog/{size}/266762_2.png","created_at":"2024-10-22T15:51:12.540Z","cooked":"
paulonis:

you are willing to take a manual riveter to competition

It’s so hard to go back - even from air powered but especially from the Milwaukee

JAAMES:

also any ideas on how to escape the roibi ecosystem

What does “escape” mean? Are you looking for another brand of tools (likely cordless tools) to standardize on? Milwaukee M12 has quite a selection of lighter-duty tools that work well for many robotics needs and are compact for transport.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":33,"updated_at":"2024-10-22T16:00:17.611Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":384,"readers_count":383,"score":111.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":473434,"topic_slug":"rivet-gun-and-escaping-the-roibi-ecosystem","display_username":"paulonis","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.milwaukeetool.com/Innovations/M12","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"M12 Performance Driven Subcompact Technology","clicks":6}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":22261,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/rivet-gun-and-escaping-the-roibi-ecosystem/473434/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3437714,"name":"","username":"AaronUp","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/aaronup/{size}/151708_2.png","created_at":"2024-10-22T16:02:13.738Z","cooked":"

If this gun is taking too many pulls, it probably needs to be primed. The instructions will show how to add hydraulic fluid. We had the same issue and bought another gun before realizing this.

Also +1 for the m12 gun, way more convenient.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":33,"updated_at":"2024-10-22T16:02:13.738Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":362,"readers_count":361,"score":107.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":473434,"topic_slug":"rivet-gun-and-escaping-the-roibi-ecosystem","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":3564,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1768 Drive Coach "},"post_url":"/t/rivet-gun-and-escaping-the-roibi-ecosystem/473434/8","custom_user_title":"1768 Drive Coach ","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3437715,"name":"JAMES","username":"JAAMES","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jaames/{size}/231436_2.png","created_at":"2024-10-22T16:02:24.224Z","cooked":"

I mean we are stuck in the roibi battery system and we are hesitant to spend the money to get out of the ecosystem. Just wondering if anybody had any ideas?

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":33,"updated_at":"2024-10-22T16:02:24.224Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":355,"readers_count":354,"score":96.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":473434,"topic_slug":"rivet-gun-and-escaping-the-roibi-ecosystem","display_username":"JAMES","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":22261,"username":"paulonis","name":"paulonis","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/5fc32e/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64837,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"_Jaames"},"post_url":"/t/rivet-gun-and-escaping-the-roibi-ecosystem/473434/9","custom_user_title":"_Jaames","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3437728,"name":"paulonis","username":"paulonis","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/5fc32e/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-10-22T16:13:13.619Z","cooked":"

I’m not aware of any line of cordless tools that works with another manufacturer’s batteries. Lack of interoperability is the foundation of the design.

There are adapters that might work with specific tool/battery combinations. Here is one for using Ryobi batteries on DeWalt tools. This doesn’t look like a great solution to me, but I’ve never seen anything better.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":33,"updated_at":"2024-10-22T16:13:13.619Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":352,"readers_count":351,"score":75.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":473434,"topic_slug":"rivet-gun-and-escaping-the-roibi-ecosystem","display_username":"paulonis","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.amazon.com/Adapter-Tools-Battery-Convert-Cordless/dp/B0CG38PFLN/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":14}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":22261,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/rivet-gun-and-escaping-the-roibi-ecosystem/473434/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3437729,"name":"Mike Marandola","username":"Mike_Marandola","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mike_marandola/{size}/255213_2.png","created_at":"2024-10-22T16:16:18.664Z","cooked":"

Rivet gun so nice we bought it twice

The 6 inch extension is very nice to have as well

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":33,"updated_at":"2024-10-22T16:16:18.664Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":331,"readers_count":330,"score":121.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":473434,"topic_slug":"rivet-gun-and-escaping-the-roibi-ecosystem","display_username":"Mike Marandola","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":9303,"username":"Tim708","name":"Tim James","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tim708/{size}/189359_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":11375,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1983N11"},"post_url":"/t/rivet-gun-and-escaping-the-roibi-ecosystem/473434/11","custom_user_title":"1983N11","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3437733,"name":"Rod","username":"Weldingrod1","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/weldingrod1/{size}/162109_2.png","created_at":"2024-10-22T16:24:32.165Z","cooked":"

I can confirm that the Makita riveter is OMG well built and works like a champ! I bought four carcasses and assembled them into two working riveters with a bunch of repair parts. FAR far cheaper than buying them at $1k each! The Makita has a crazy beautiful ball screw assembly in it that pulls the rivet. Of course I can’t find any pictures of the insides of the darn thing Here’s the Makita and the clone pulling 3/16" rivets.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":33,"updated_at":"2024-10-22T16:24:32.165Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":318,"readers_count":317,"score":83.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":473434,"topic_slug":"rivet-gun-and-escaping-the-roibi-ecosystem","display_username":"Rod","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ccCgtuLYnjc","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":46443,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/rivet-gun-and-escaping-the-roibi-ecosystem/473434/12","custom_user_title":"Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3437739,"name":"Chris Herzog","username":"zog","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/zog/{size}/266762_2.png","created_at":"2024-10-22T16:36:26.387Z","cooked":"
Weldingrod1:

The Makita has a crazy beautiful ball screw

I can confirm the eBay “clone” (it’s not really a clone but something that takes the LXT 18v batteries and is molded in near Makita “teal”) does not have a ball screw in it.

Clearly the Makita is built for the long haul.

Tim708:

It’s out of your target price range but in my opinion this is the best $250 my team has spent in a long time.

M12™ Rivet Tool (Tool Only)

Absolutely love this thing. We’ve used every rivet tool under the sun, from manual, to pneumatic, and even drill powered, but since we got our M12, we only occasionally use a manual riveter to get in particularly tight spots, we basically don’t even pack the other tools anymore.

JAAMES:

(also any ideas on how to escape the roibi ecosystem)

You do know Ryobi is the entry level Milwaukee tools, right?
They are made by the same company just to hit different price points. Similar to how Black & Decker and DeWalt are the same.

Pro Tool Reviews – 27 May 24

Power Tool Manufacturers and Who Really Owns Them - 2024

It may surprise you that only a handful of larger companies own your favorite power tool manufacturers. Here's who owns who...with lists!

Est. reading time: 16 minutes

Also we have the Milwaukee M12 rivet tool because it works best for the job we need it for. The M18 is too expensive for us but goes up to 1/4 inch. When we need to do large rivets we go pneumatic and have a Harbor freight tool for that that was like $50

We primarily use DeWalt 20V because the price point and quality is right for team use.

Peter_Matteson:

You do know Ryobi is the entry level Milwaukee tools, right?
They are made by the same company just to hit different price points. Similar to how Black & Decker and DeWalt are the same.

This is only partially true, while they are owned by the same parent company Ryobi tools are made by Ryobi and Milwaukee is made by Milwaukee. Different engineers, designs, tooling, buildings, test requirements, etc. You unfortunately cannot use batteries interchangeably.

paulonis:

There are adapters that might work with specific tool/battery combinations. Here is one for using Ryobi batteries on DeWalt tools . This doesn’t look like a great solution to me, but I’ve never seen anything better.

Paging @scubadiv3r for her input on battery safety.
